poem:
### To Becca

Fit and driven,  
yoga of breath and bone,  
you built spaces  
with the promise of growing—  
underneath,   
the quiet cells stirred  
in a different direction,  
untold.  
Chester's mornings woke you  
at five, hopeful.  
Life relentless,  
but not insurmountable—  
a lesson  
written gently  
in unexpected air.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I was told I had two weeks to live’ – why are so many young, fit, non-smoking women getting lung cancer? Towards the end of 2019, Becca Smith’s life was full and hectic. At 28, she had taken on a unit in Chester to convert into a yoga studio, poured in all her savings and hired teachers, while at the same time working as a personal trainer. Her days started at 5am; she was driven,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
